comment.author: 25695066@N00
comment._content: Aviator Jimmie Ward is the helmeted figure in the photo.  This photo was taken on September 13, 1911, the day Ward took off from Governors Island in his Curtiss Pusher biplane (named the "Hearst Pathfinder") as he began his attempt to win the William Randolph Hearst Prize. Otherwise known as the "Hearst Transcontinental Prize" or "Hearst Prize", $50,000 was offered by William Randolph Hearst in October 1910 to the first aviator to complete a transcontinental flight across the United States in less than 30 days, no later than October 11, 1911. Jimmie Ward would withdraw from the race nine days later after his aircraft's engine failed, causing it to crash land just west of Addison, New York, suffering damage beyond repair.
